abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Rehabilitation Credit
            support the first phase of the Government's adjustment
            program. The principal objectives of this phase of the
            program are to improve resource use in two important areas
            of the economy; public finance and the cotton sector. The
            measures in public finance are designed to increase
            budgetary revenues, augment development oriented current
            expenditures, and improve investment programming. The
            economic and financial viability of the cotton sector will
            be improved through measures to reduce costs of the cotton
            parastatal, improve extension and research, strengthen the
            sector's institutional set-up, and reform pricing
            policy. The Financial Rehabilitation Credit also resolve the
            problem of COTONTCHAD's arrears to the banking system.
            In addition, the program includes studies to prepare future
            adjustment measures in public finance/administration, the
            public enterprise sector, and agriculture.
